headline: Why Was the Market Down Today?
summary: Technology stocks were driving market benchmarks lower Thursday, but many sectors and stocks were spared from the downturn.  Microsoft was the biggest reason U.S. stocks were down.  Microsoft fell 10% after investors raised worries about the company's cloud-business revenue.

raw.headline: Why Was the Market Down Today?

headline: Why Is the Market Down Today?
summary: Technology stocks are driving market benchmarks lower Thursday, but many sectors and stocks have been spared from the downturn.  Microsoft is the biggest reason U.S. stocks are down at the moment.  This afternoon, Microsoft is down 12% after investors raised worries about the company's cloud-business revenue.

headline: Stocks Slip as Gold, Silver Hit New Records
summary: STOCKS  Disappointing earnings from Microsoft fed into a tech selloff Thursday, pushing the Nasdaq composite down more than 1%. Investors recoiled after Microsoft reported higher-than-expected spending on AI infrastructure and slower cloud growth, putting its stock on course for the worst pullback since early 2020.

headline: Software stocks fall premarket as Microsoft and SAP results weigh

headline: 3 Software Stocks We Steer Clear Of
summary: Software is rapidly reducing operating expenses for businesses. Companies bringing it to life have been rewarded with high valuation multiples that make fundraising easier, but they have weighed on the returns lately as the industry has pulled back by 13.1% over the past six months. This drop is a far cry from the S&P 500’s 9.5% ascent.
